intro: Pycnostelma paniculatum var. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy pycnostelma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "hirsutum." The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in panicles, which are typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
